item.title: By: Chuck
item.dc:creator: Chuck
item.content:encoded:
Ted, this is a great post on the Copy Database wizard. I have some questions, mostly regarding the destination file properties. On my SQL2005 db server, I have several DB’s. I want to copy one to the other to refresh the data (from a prod db to a test db – on the same server). The test db already exists. On the test db / properties / files, the “logical name” is the same as the prod db / properties / files. However, the physical name is different.

So when I am completing the Copy Database wizard and specifying the destination database files, do I leave the default as is? It has the logical name, not the physical name. This is tricky, because on the prod db, the logical and physical names are the SAME. I don’t want to attempt to copy my prod database and overwrite itself!!!

Can you help me?
